bill_title: provide for the use and acceptance of electronic signatures.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the use and acceptance of electronic signatures. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. For the purposes of this Act, the term, electronic signature, means a method of signing a record, through electronic means, that identifies and authenticates a particular person as the source of the record and indicates the person's approval of the information contained in the record. Section 2. The use or acceptance of an electronic signature shall be at the option of both parties. Nothing in this Act requires an entity to use or permit the use of an electronic signature. Section 3. An electronic signature may be used to sign a record and has the same force and effect as a written signature. Section 4. Filing a record signed using an electronic signature with a state agency is prima facie evidence that the record was filed by the person to whom the electronic signature has been assigned. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
